Package com.mystic_alchemy.ics2java.calendar

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.mystic_alchemy.ics2java.calendar.Event
public class Event extends Object
Represents iCal VEVENT type entries with their UID, location, summary, description, start and optionally the recurrence frequency.
Since:
0.1
Version:
0.2
Author:
PilleniusMC for Mystic-Alchemy

    • getSummary

      public String getSummary()
      Gets the summary for this event
      Returns:
      the summary, a short descriptor of the event, e.g. "Alex's Birthday"

      public void setSummary​(String summary)
      Sets the summary of this event

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Gets the description of this event.
      Returns:
      the description

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription​(String description)
      Sets the description of this event.

      The description can include additional info for this event and should extend the summary.

      Parameters:
      description - a longer description for this event

    • getDtStart

      public LocalDate getDtStart()
      Gets the start date for this event. If no recurrence is set, then this is also when the event is happening.
      Returns:
      the start date or null

    • setDtStart

      public void setDtStart​(@NotNull @NotNull LocalDate dtStart)
      Sets the start date for this event. If no recurrence is set, then this is also when the event is happening.
      Parameters:
      dtStart - the start date

    • getFreq

      @Nullable public @Nullable RecurrenceFrequency getFreq()
      Gets the frequency of recurrence for this event. If this event is not recurring, then null would be returned.
      Returns:
      recurrence frequency or null

    • setFreq

      public void setFreq​(@Nullable @Nullable RecurrenceFrequency freq)
      Sets this event to be recurrent or not, including the frequency of recurrence. null would be equal to no recurrence, whereas any set value would imply recurrence.
      Parameters:
      freq - the recurrence frequency or null
      See Also:
      RecurrenceFrequency

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Generates a string for this event, which is made up of the summary, the start date in ISO 8601 format, the location(-s), and if applicable the frequency of recurrence.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representing this object
